value: Furniture Design: Elevation of a Pedestal or Case

value: The left half of the elevation of a pedestal or of a case.  At center, on a bracket, a girl kneels.

Designs for Chimney Mantels for the Hôtel de Pomponne, Place des Victoires, Paris

label: Description
value: The left half of a fireplace wall, showing the mirror frame, terminates in a volute. Within the mirror area, a reduced, similar scheme is depicted. A vertical carved panel with a figure of Fame and a fountain below is at left. Both chimneywalls are decorated with carved ornaments and foliage. This is probably an alternate design for those published in Livre de Differentes Decorations d'Apartements, Suite SS.

label: Physical description
value: Pen with brush and black, red ink, graphite on two sheets of joined cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of Léon Decloux, Paris

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Notes
value: The left half of a fireplace wall, showing the mirror frame, terminates in a volute. Within the mirror area, a reduced, similar scheme is depicted. A vertical carved panel with a figure of Fame and a fountain below is at left. Both chimneywalls are decorated with carved ornaments and foliage. This is probably an alternate design for those published in Livre de Differentes Decorations d'Apartements, Suite SS.
Design for a Panel with Two Mirrors

label: Description
value: The edge of the design of right half (2) is pasted over that of a left half (1).  Either design includes an upper oval and a lower oblong mirror.  (1) suggests horizontal, (2) vertical, lower mirrors.  Either design suggests a female mask in the top center of the upper mirror, (A) a second one in the bottom center of the upper mirror and a vase over the center of the bottom mirror.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and water color over black chalk on paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Sèvres, France (in collection by 1906)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Overmantel; recto, Plans of Moldings

label: Description
value: Slightly more than left half of overmantel with pilaster panel at left. The mirror frame with dragon in top center rises from top of mantel.  Decoration of pilaster includes medallion with a lion in center. A fragment of section or plan with parts of letters, lower right.  Inscribed at center right:  Cheminée et Plaq(ard)/de la chambre a couch (er).  Verso:  in opposite direction, top:  two rows of plans referring to consecutive moldings.  Annoated in margin:  Cadre des Pilastres; and A bottom; A bases (?) du Plaqcard.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, black chalk on paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Sèvres, France (in his collection in 1906)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Fountain in a Park

label: Description
value: A large urn, with divided handles rests on a plinth from which water issues from masks on three sides.  At left, a tree and relief of a group of standing figures.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, graphite on paper, framing lines in black ink, lined

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Sèvres, France, acquired after 1906

label: Description
value: Figures of river god and four nymphs on a rock at the base of which a bull crouches.  The letter F is shown in reverse at the center of figural grouping.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and white gouache (corrections), green watercolor on paper, framing lines in pen and black ink, squared

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Sèvres, France, acquired after 1906

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for an Oval Frame on Theme of Venus Victorious

label: Description
value: Oval frame showing in top center an escutcheon with Venus head and her girdle. Lambrequins hang at the bottom, the central one shows a pair of doves on globe under a star. A pair of torches. At left rises a bough of myrtle.  Much of the decoration of the right half is not shown.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Hippolyte Destailleur (sale Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 469); Léon Decloux, Sèvres, France, acquired by him after 1906.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Elevation of an Altar Retable

label: Description
value: Recto: The left half is shown. Two paintings in a vertical row are suggested for the central part, which is topped by the royal French crown. the lateral part is obliquely disposed. A twisted column stands free at the inside beside two statutes of St. John the Evangelist and St. Luke, both seated. A flying angel lifts the curtain over them which hangs downward from a lambrequin showin fleur-de-lys. Volutes form the top, two angels with palm boughs being suggested affixed to them. Verso: sketches of a similar altar in black chalk.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Title Page, Cahier des Parasols Chinois

label: Description
value: Under fanciful trees, a Chinese man and woman are seated on a section of rustic fence, over which hangs a cloth intended for the title.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and black ink, black chalk

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A central fountain with nude female figural sculpture decorating base spouting water into a pool below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink ,brush and wash on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two sections of bookcases are divided and flanked by carved panels of boiserie; at the left, a door and a wide and narrow panel, the wider one flanked by sconces and decorated with carved festoons and a mirror; at the right, desk containing a clock and above, a carved picture or mirror frame; over the bookcases--statuary, vases, and a map-globe. On verso, pencil sketch of a console table with indications of scale.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black and red ink, brush and gray and rose wash on two sheets of white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

Design for an Overdoor and Chimney

label: Description
value: Three putti are shown in the overdoor. A pair of billing doves, a quiver and a torch are in the top center of the frame of the mirror over the chimney.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and brown watercolor, graphite

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Physical description
value: A cloacked figure is seen seated in meditation near a herm. Above, the flying nude figure of Diana, who pours water from two pitchers.She appears against clouds and an arc, on which rest two urns, one superimposed on the other, and from which two swags issue.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
A Royal French Galley Seen from the Stern

label: Description
value: Seen from the stern, a ship at anchor with sails lowered.  The stern is elaborately decorated with figures and scenes.  A royal coat of arms at top of the mast.  Figures shown seated or standing on the gun rails.  Ladders lowered on two sides. Land visible in distance.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brush and black ink, wash on vellum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Chimney Piece and Adjoining Bays with Alternative Suggestions

label: Description
value: The left half includes a candle bracket showing a child holding two scrolls topped by sockets; a medallion with the bust of a woman under a canopy; a painting with a woman and two children one of whom is Cupid. The decoration is sparser in the right half. Bottom margin; plans of the mantelpiece.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Wall Elevation with Wood Paneling

label: Description
value: A door frame with an overdoor at left, two children with torches in escutcheons. Pilaster strips alternate with broader panels. Billing doves are suggested for the left panel.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The overdoor is decorated with a trophy composed of Cupid's quiver, Hymen's torch and boughs, suspended from a whirl with a bow-knot. Wall panels and pilasters are carved.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Some details of the sparse decoration are suggested differently, and alternatively, in the left and right halves. Flanked by narrow wall panels, the central panel and two more with the door frames project. A decorated panel is slightly sketched inside the left door frame, probably reffering to a blind door.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value:
The design springs from two seated female figures with a vase between them, from which rises a column supporting prancing horses. Above, a relief panel and a semi-circular columned niche with a statue of a stand-female figure before a drapery. Atalantes at either side and seated griffins above. At top, a medallion supported by flying half-figures, above which are winged female figures bearing trumpets and wreaths, flanking a lyre. Arabesque tendrils connect the various parts. (RPW'60)
Attribution to Prieur made by Leon Decloux.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: In the center, Bacchus standing under a grape arbor issuing from urns, and a brazier at the top. At the bottom, a herm, flanked by drum and tambourine, hanging from garlands.

Wall Elevation of a Bedroom Alcove

label: Description
value: White-toned walls with blue accents. A day bed is arranged in an alcove, under draped canopy, against a bouquet of flowers, lyre, and a water bird painted on the back wall.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line

label: Notes
value: White-toned walls with blue accents. A day bed is arranged in an alcove, under draped canopy, against a bouquet of flowers, lyre, and a water bird painted on the back wall.

label: Description
value: Elevation of a section of a painted wall showing an alcove at center hung with tasseled draperies above a day bed with blue pillows. Predominate color scheme is white, blue and gold. Trophies on side walls include quivers, arrows, swords, ribbons and doves, possibly indicating a theme of love.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Collection of Leon Decloux (acquired by him after 1906)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Elevation of the Wall of a Salon

label: Description
value: Interior wall decoration for a salon with gold molding, oval and rectangular mirrors/panels; decorations include floral rinceau with bows and arrows throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, black wash, graphite on white heightening on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Designs for Six Trophies Composed of Hunting Attributes

label: Description
value: Six designs for hunting trophies. Upper left: French horn, rifle, dead pheasant and rabbit, along with wild flowers; upper right: arrows, blue quiver, a live pheasant, and wild flowers; center left: pink and gold quiver with arrows, a rifle, and hanging canteen, and a bird, surrounded by wild flowers; center right: stag’s head, pickaxes, an arrow, a French horn, a net, and some wild flowers; lower left: pickaxe and fasces, netting, French horn, canteen, leather pouch, arrow, staff, and twigs with leaves; lower right: dead rabbit, pheasant, and greenery in a basket, rifle, laurel garland supported by a staff.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, white heightening, pen and black ink, graphite on cream paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Six Trophies composed of Military Attributes

label: Description
value: Two columns of six military trophies. Upper left: drums and crossed banners, fasces and pickaxe; upper right: soldier’s upper body armor, axe, and sword; center left: cannon, spiked staff; center right: cannon balls, arrow, basket with scythe; lower left: basket, musket, banners, helmet; lower right: drum, shield, and banners.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gouache on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Project for Book Illustration; A Panel with Attributes of Sciences and of a Hero

label: Description
value: The inner framings are influenced by Watteau's designs. Niches form lines and stripes along the edges.  A trophy composed of books, one of which contains descriptions of medals, plans, weapons, collar with medals, a globe as an alter with fire. A burning lamp hangs in top center.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Project for Book Illustration; A Panel with Attributes and Recollections of a Hero

label: Description
value: The inner framings are influenced by Watteau's designs. Niches form lines and stripes along the edges.  A trophy composed of books, weapons, plants, fruit, an inkstand, the book showing medals. Three balls of an indistinct character float before the upper part of the niche. A cross, mace, and medals are suspended from the top.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink on paper, brush and ink wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
